title: Ranked Howling Abyss
body: Hey, Does anyone else think there should be a ranked system on Howling Abyss.

replies.body:
Hey, I should of provided more info, If there was to be a ranked system on Howling Abyss you should be able to obviously pick your champion, Not be randomised. 

Cheers.

Except this is counter-intuitive to the entire point of ARAM, since it is supposed to be "All Random All Mid". By taking away the randomness of ARAM, you are taking away one of the core aspects of the mode.

The idea has been thrown around before, and while there are some players who have found appeal in it, the general consensus is usually that it would simply be based too heavily on RNG to be viable. The fact is, competitive play *should* be determined by the skill of a player, not their luck. With the innate randomness of the "random pick" mode that ARAM uses, skill is essentially thrown out the window in favour of luck. Either you get lucky with a champion and/or team composition that works, or you don't. Either way, there's often one team that just get's stomped.

Quite frankly, I can't see a ranked ARAM queue getting enough attention from the player base to make it worth the effort to create and maintain, even on larger servers like NA.

It wouldn't so much display skill, it would just be like a free-for-all on a ONE LANED map.
So bad idea tbh.
